Pre-Game Insights: Croatia appear to be embarking upon the new international cycle by sticking with the tried and tested.

Poland, under the management of Michal Probierz, endured a difficult UEFA EURO 2024 campaign after only making the tournament with a penalty shootout victory over Wales at the Cardiff City Stadium in the playoffs in March.

There is a chance that things become quite stale with this generation of Croatian talent, despite the emergence in the last couple of years of one of the best defenders in the world in Josko Gvardiol as well as the current form of Andrej Kramaric.
Poland are not a team that score three too often so their win against Scotland cannot be taken as the new look Poland, especially when it involved a goal from distance as well as two penalties.
The likelihood remains a low-scoring affair.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Poland found themselves 2-0 up against Scotland in Glasgow with a goal from range scored by Sebastian Szymanski and then a penalty from Robert Lewandowski.
Nicola Zalewski’s 97th minute penalty eventually gave them a 3-2 win after Scotland had fought back.
Others: Croatia vs Poland Prediction: UNDER 3.5 GOALS
KICK-OFF DATE/TIME: Sunday 8th September, 2024 - UK – 7:45pm / US ET – 2:45pm / US PT – 11:45am
HOW TO WATCH ON TV: UK – TBC / US – FOX Sports
HOW TO WATCH ONLINE: UK – TBC / US – FOX Sports streaming platforms
